title: Millet-stuffed Cabbage Rolls with Mushroom Sauce

ingredients.content: 6 - 12 savoy cabbage leaves (6 large leaves or 12 small leaves)
200 g fresh mushrooms (e.g. button, wild, shiitake)
½ - ¾ tsp ground black pepper, to taste
½ - ¾ tsp salt, to taste
¼ - ½ tsp ground black pepper, to taste

preparations.content: Insert simmering basket in mixing bowl and add millet to it. Add water, then use spatula to stir and wet the millet. Prepare cabbage leaves, removing central stalk of larger leaves and place leaves in Varoma dish. Set Varoma in position and steam <b>16 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.
Set Varoma dish aside on Varoma lid to allow leaves to drain and cool. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and set aside. Empty cooking liquid into a jug and set aside.
Place onions and garlic in mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>.

Add mushrooms and chop <b>4 sec/speed 4.5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Set scale to zero and using a spoon, transfer 100 g chopped onion-garlic-mushroom mixture (scale will show '-100 g') to a small bowl and set aside for sauce.
Add butter to remaining chopped mixture in mixing bowl and, without measuring cup, sauté <b>3 min/120°C/speed 1<b>.

Add reserved steamed millet, salt and pepper and mix <b>10 sec//speed 4<b> while stirring with aid of spatula. Adjust seasoning to taste. Place 2-3 tbsp of stuffing on each steamed cabbage leaf and roll up. Place rolls in Varoma dish and tray, making sure overlapping ends of cabbage leaves are tucked under the rolls.

Place 500 g reserved cooking liquid in mixing bowl, set Varoma in position and steam <b>30 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Set covered Varoma aside on a plate to keep warm. Empty cooking liquid into a jug and set aside this second cooking liquid for the mushroom sauce.
Place butter and reserved chopped onion-garlic-mushroom mixture in mixing bowl and sauté <b>5 min/120°C/speed 1<b>.
Add cream and 200 g of the reserved second cooking liquid and cook <b>5 min/98°C/speed 1<b>.
Add salt and pepper and blend <b>20 sec/speed 9<b>, then adjust seasoning to taste. Serve stuffed cabbage rolls hot, drizzled with mushroom sauce.

hintsAndTricks: We have revisited a Polish dish with this recipe to include millet as well as mushrooms. Millet is a really tasty, nutrient-rich vegetarian alternative to meat, enhanced here by the rich mushroom sauce.
Serve with a green salad garnished with chopped red peppers or pomegranate seeds.
